revised_title: Taxonomic Characters of North Chinese Phlebotomus Species
tldr: The authors describe the taxonomic characters of the early stages of three North Chinese species of the genus Phlebotomus, focusing on the structure and arrangement of bristles. They provide detailed descriptions of the eggs, first, second, third, and fourth larval instars, and discuss the differences in bristle patterns that help distinguish between the species. This study contributes to the understanding of Phlebotomus species identification and classification.
